radiographic_examinations.findings: Evidence of degenerative disk disease of the cervical spine and a pulmonary nodule (8 mm in diameter) in the left upper lobe.

radiographic_examinations.date: Three months after the initial visit
radiographic_examinations.findings: The nodule in the left upper lobe had not changed in size.

radiographic_examinations.date: Five months after the initial visit
radiographic_examinations.findings: Pulmonary nodule increased in size to 1 cm, tethered to the overlying pleura in the left upper lobe, increased FDG uptake; a contiguous nodule (7 mm) with increased FDG uptake; new nodules in the right middle lobe; intense diffuse FDG uptake in the stomach; wall thickening of terminal ileum and cecum with adjacent inflammatory fat stranding.

radiographic_examinations.date: Approximately 9 months after the initial visit

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: Eleven months after the initial visit
radiographic_examinations.findings: Hematoma in the right anterior pararenal space from a subcapsular hematoma in the right kidney; extravasation of blood into the retroperitoneal space; soft-tissue mass at the ileocecal junction had increased in size.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Increase in circumferential wall thickening of the terminal ileum and cecum.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Increased diffuse wall thickening of the terminal ileum and cecum, with persistent mesenteric fat stranding and lymphadenopathy.
Persistent circumferential wall thickening of the terminal ileum and cecum with extensive adjacent fat stranding.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased slightly since previous imaging studies.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild interstitial pulmonary edema, small bilateral pleural effusions, confluent opacity in the left lower lobe.
